page.title: 07WILBERFOSS THE SCHOOL HEAD.
page.content: The head wakes up at 7.30 am each morning and arrives at school from nearby Pocklington at about 8.30 am. His first job is to check and open all stock cupboards. Up to morning playtime at 10.30 am he opens mail and does odd jobs like photocopying. Most days he takes classes so that other teachers can do subjects like music and games with other classes. He always has a school dinner and enjoys them! During lunchtime he attends any staff meetings and sorts out day to day problems. From lunchtime to after- noon playtime he attends to outstanding jobs such as cataloguing library books. He enjoys his job as head of the village school, but says he sometimes misses having a class of his own. Like any other job, he says, there are bad days, but these are few.
